Name: Mathematics (1)
Description: This course provides an introduction to mathematical concepts and techniques, including algebra, geometry, and trigonometry. Students will develop problem-solving skills and learn to apply mathematical models to real-world problems.

Name: Introduction to Computer Graph
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts and techniques of computer graphics, including graphics hardware, 2D and 3D graphics, and graphics programming. Students will learn to create interactive graphics applications using a programming language.

Name: Electronics (1)
Description: This course covers the basics of electronics, including circuit analysis, electronic components, and circuit design. Students will learn to analyze and design simple electronic circuits.

Name: English (1)
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of English language and literature, including grammar, composition, and literary analysis. Students will learn to write effectively and analyze literary texts.

Name: Mathematics (2)
Description: This course builds on the concepts introduced in Mathematics (1), covering more advanced topics in algebra, geometry, and trigonometry. Students will develop their problem-solving skills and learn to apply mathematical models to more complex problems.

Name: Electronics (2)
Description: This course continues the study of electronics, covering more advanced topics in circuit analysis, electronic components, and circuit design. Students will learn to analyze and design more complex electronic circuits.

Name: English (2)
Description: This course continues the study of English language and literature, covering more advanced topics in grammar, composition, and literary analysis. Students will learn to write critically and analyze complex literary texts.

Name: Physics
Description: This course introduces the fundamental principles of physics, including motion, energy, and matter. Students will learn to apply physical laws to solve problems and understand natural phenomena.

Name: Mathematics (3)
Description: This course covers advanced topics in mathematics, including calculus, differential equations, and linear algebra. Students will develop their problem-solving skills and learn to apply mathematical models to complex problems.

Name: Principles of Management
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of management, including planning, organizing, leading, and controlling. Students will learn to apply management principles to business and organizational settings.

Name: English (3)
Description: This course covers advanced topics in English language and literature, including literary theory, critical analysis, and creative writing. Students will learn to write critically and analyze complex literary texts.

Name: Logic Design
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of logic design, including digital circuits, Boolean algebra, and logic gates. Students will learn to design and analyze digital circuits.

Name: Operations Research
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of operations research, including linear programming, dynamic programming, and decision analysis. Students will learn to apply mathematical models to optimize business decisions.

Name: Statistical Methods
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of statistics, including data analysis, probability, and statistical inference. Students will learn to apply statistical methods to analyze data and make informed decisions.

Name: Basics Economics
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of economics, including microeconomics, macroeconomics, and international trade. Students will learn to apply economic principles to business and policy decisions.

Name: Data Communications
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of data communications, including data transmission, networking, and communication protocols. Students will learn to design and analyze data communication systems.

Name: English (4)
Description: This course continues the study of English language and literature, covering more advanced topics in literary theory, critical analysis, and creative writing. Students will learn to write critically and analyze complex literary texts.

Name: English (5)
Description: This course covers specialized topics in English language and literature, including linguistics, stylistics, and literary criticism. Students will learn to apply linguistic and literary theories to analyze texts.

Name: Local Area Network
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of local area networks, including network architecture, protocols, and network management. Students will learn to design and analyze local area networks.

Name: Networks Communications protocol
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of network communications protocols, including TCP/IP, HTTP, and FTP. Students will learn to design and analyze network communications protocols.

Name: Wide Area Network Technology
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of wide area networks, including network architecture, protocols, and network management. Students will learn to design and analyze wide area networks.

Name: Wireless LAN
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of wireless local area networks, including wireless network architecture, protocols, and network management. Students will learn to design and analyze wireless local area networks.

Name: Intelligence Networks
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of intelligence networks, including network architecture, protocols, and network management. Students will learn to design and analyze intelligence networks.

Name: Network Operating Systems
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of network operating systems, including network architecture, protocols, and network management. Students will learn to design and analyze network operating systems.

Name: Managing, Operating, and Repair
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of managing, operating, and repairing computer systems, including system administration, troubleshooting, and maintenance. Students will learn to manage, operate, and repair computer systems.

Name: Computer Networks
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of computer networks, including network architecture, protocols, and network management. Students will learn to design and analyze computer networks.

Name: Network Security Techniques
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of network security techniques, including firewalls, encryption, and access control. Students will learn to design and analyze network security systems.

Name: Satellite Communications
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of satellite communications, including satellite systems, protocols, and network management. Students will learn to design and analyze satellite communications systems.

Name: Switching and routing technology
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of switching and routing technology, including network architecture, protocols, and network management. Students will learn to design and analyze switching and routing systems.

Name: Integrated Service Digital Net
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of integrated service digital networks, including network architecture, protocols, and network management. Students will learn to design and analyze integrated service digital networks.

Name: Introduction to Computer & App
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of computer science, including programming, algorithms, and data structures. Students will learn to write programs and develop software applications.

Name: Structured Programming
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of structured programming, including programming languages, data structures, and algorithms. Students will learn to write efficient and well-structured programs.

Name: Object Oriented Programming
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of object-oriented programming, including classes, objects, and inheritance. Students will learn to design and develop object-oriented programs.

Name: Operating Systems
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of operating systems, including process management, memory management, and file systems. Students will learn to design and analyze operating systems.

Name: Computer interface & Peripherals
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of computer interfaces and peripherals, including input/output devices, storage devices, and communication interfaces. Students will learn to design and analyze computer interfaces and peripherals.

Name: Computer Architecture&Organiza
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of computer architecture and organization, including CPU design, memory hierarchy, and input/output systems. Students will learn to design and analyze computer architectures.

Name: Introduction to Information sy
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of information systems, including system analysis, design, and implementation. Students will learn to design and develop information systems.

Name: System Analysis
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of system analysis, including system modeling, system design, and system implementation. Students will learn to analyze and design information systems.

Name: Software Engineering (1)
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of software engineering, including software design, development, and testing. Students will learn to design and develop software systems.

Name: Computer Graphics
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of computer graphics, including graphics hardware, 2D and 3D graphics, and graphics programming. Students will learn to create interactive graphics applications using a programming language.

Name: Logic Programming
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of logic programming, including logic languages, logic programming paradigms, and logic programming applications. Students will learn to write logic programs and develop expert systems.

Name: Graduation Project
Description: This course requires students to complete a graduation project, which involves designing, developing, and presenting a software application or system.

Name: Modeling and Simulation
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of modeling and simulation, including mathematical modeling, simulation techniques, and simulation software. Students will learn to develop models and simulate complex systems.

Name: Artificial Intelligence
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of artificial intelligence, including machine learning, natural language processing, and computer vision. Students will learn to develop intelligent systems and applications.

Name: Software Engineering (2 )
Description: This course continues the study of software engineering, covering more advanced topics in software design, development, and testing. Students will learn to design and develop large-scale software systems.

Name: Compiler Theory
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of compiler theory, including compiler design, compiler implementation, and compiler optimization. Students will learn to design and develop compilers.

Name: Network Programming
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of network programming, including socket programming, network protocols, and distributed systems. Students will learn to develop networked applications and systems.

Name: Image Processing
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of image processing, including image representation, image enhancement, and image analysis. Students will learn to develop image processing applications and systems.

Name: Expert Systems
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of expert systems, including knowledge representation, inference engines, and expert system applications. Students will learn to develop expert systems and knowledge-based systems.

Name: Theory of Computing
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of theory of computing, including automata theory, formal languages, and computability theory. Students will learn to analyze and develop algorithms.

Name: Distributed and Parallel Compu
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of distributed and parallel computing, including parallel algorithms, distributed systems, and high-performance computing. Students will learn to develop parallel and distributed applications.

Name: Multi-Media
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of multi-media, including audio and video processing, image processing, and multi-media applications. Students will learn to develop multi-media applications and systems.

Name: Distributed Computing
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of distributed computing, including parallel algorithms, distributed systems, and high-performance computing. Students will learn to develop parallel and distributed applications.

Name: Neural Networks
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of neural networks, including neural network architectures, learning algorithms, and neural network applications. Students will learn to develop neural networks and intelligent systems.

Name: Design of Information Systems
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of information system design, including system architecture, system integration, and system testing. Students will learn to design and develop information systems.

Name: Internet & Internet Programmin
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of internet and internet programming, including web development, web design, and web applications. Students will learn to develop web applications and systems.

Name: Computer Graphics (2)
Description: This course continues the study of computer graphics, covering more advanced topics in graphics hardware, 2D and 3D graphics, and graphics programming. Students will learn to create interactive graphics applications using a programming language.

Name: Pattern Recognition
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of pattern recognition, including pattern classification, pattern recognition algorithms, and pattern recognition applications. Students will learn to develop pattern recognition systems and applications.

Name: Microprocessor - Based Syste
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of microprocessor-based systems, including microprocessor architecture, microprocessor programming, and microprocessor applications. Students will learn to design and develop microprocessor-based systems.

Name: Field Training (1)
Description: This course provides students with practical experience in a field or industry related to their major. Students will learn to apply theoretical concepts to real-world problems and develop professional skills.

Name: Field Training (2)
Description: This course continues the field training experience, providing students with more advanced practical experience in a field or industry related to their major. Students will learn to apply theoretical concepts to complex real-world problems and develop advanced professional skills.

Name: Field Training (3)
Description: This course provides students with specialized practical experience in a field or industry related to their major. Students will learn to apply theoretical concepts to complex real-world problems and develop specialized professional skills.

Name: Field Training (4)
Description: This course continues the field training experience, providing students with advanced specialized practical experience in a field or industry related to their major. Students will learn to apply theoretical concepts to complex real-world problems and develop advanced specialized professional skills.

Name: Humanities (1)
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of humanities, including philosophy, history, and culture. Students will learn to analyze and appreciate humanistic texts and artifacts.

Name: Humanities
Description: This course continues the study of humanities, covering more advanced topics in philosophy, history, and culture. Students will learn to analyze and appreciate complex humanistic texts and artifacts.

Name: Data Structures
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of data structures, including arrays, linked lists, stacks, and queues. Students will learn to design and analyze data structures.

Name: File Organization
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of file organization, including file systems, data storage, and data retrieval. Students will learn to design and analyze file systems.

Name: Database Management Systems
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of database management systems, including database design, database implementation, and database management. Students will learn to design and develop database systems.

Name: Decision support system
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of decision support systems, including decision analysis, decision models, and decision support system applications. Students will learn to develop decision support systems and business intelligence applications.

Name: Database Management Systems 2
Description: This course continues the study of database management systems, covering more advanced topics in database design, database implementation, and database management. Students will learn to design and develop advanced database systems.

Name: Information Engineering
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of information engineering, including system analysis, system design, and system implementation. Students will learn to design and develop information systems.

Name: Computer Security Techniques
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of computer security techniques, including cryptography, access control, and intrusion detection. Students will learn to design and analyze computer security systems.

Name: Distributed Database
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of distributed databases, including database design, database implementation, and database management. Students will learn to design and develop distributed database systems.

Name: Geographical Information Systems
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of geographical information systems, including GIS architecture, GIS applications, and GIS analysis. Students will learn to design and develop GIS applications and systems.

Name: Office Automation Systems
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of office automation systems, including system analysis, system design, and system implementation. Students will learn to design and develop office automation systems.

Name: Management Information System
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of management information systems, including system analysis, system design, and system implementation. Students will learn to design and develop management information systems.

Name: Electronic Commerce
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of electronic commerce, including e-commerce architecture, e-commerce applications, and e-commerce analysis. Students will learn to design and develop e-commerce applications and systems.

Name: Data warehousing
Description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of data warehousing, including data warehousing architecture, data warehousing applications, and data warehousing analysis. Students will learn to design and develop data warehousing systems.

Name: Data Mining
Description: This course explores methods and algorithms for discovering patterns and knowledge from large datasets, including data preprocessing, data mining techniques, and applications in business and science.

Name: Project Management
Description: This course covers principles and practices of project management, including project planning, scheduling, budgeting, risk management, and project evaluation.

Name: Software Quality Assurance
Description: This course focuses on techniques and methodologies for ensuring the quality of software products, including software testing, quality metrics, defect tracking, and software quality management.

Name: Physical Education
Description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of physical education, including exercise science, sports management, and physical activity. Students will learn to apply physical education principles to promote health and wellness.

Name: Physical Education 2
Description: This course continues the study of physical education, covering more advanced topics in exercise science, sports management, and physical activity. Students will learn to apply physical education principles to promote health and wellness.
